results.title: Iran
results.creator_credit: Claude Lelouch, Paul Laffargue, Pierre Pardon, Aria Productions S A and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: An impressionistic collage without commentary, directed by Claude Lelouch. Iran is shown as a country in transition. On the one hand it has modern cities, the oil industry and cosmopolitan city dwellers, and on the other hand it has mud villages, and is home for ethnic minority groups and families steeped in the tradition of making rugs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Lelouch, Paul Laffargue, Pierre Pardon, Aria Productions S A and Pyramid Films

results.title: Ionization energy
results.creator_credit: David W. Ridgway, CHEM Study Films and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: Presents two methods of measuring ionisation energy: photo-ionisation and electron bombardment. A high vacuum system is used with a simple conductivity cell. The photo-ionisation of sodium by the use of a mercury light source and monochromator is carried out. The electron bombardment method is then demonstrated with sodium and three inert gases. Animation shows what occurs on the atomic level during the ionisation process.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David W. Ridgway, CHEM Study Films and Davidson Films

results.title: Iola's promise
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith, Nathan Hirsh and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: A love story involving a young Indian girl, Iola, with a white prospector, Harper, who rescuses Iola from the hands of two cut-throats. Iola soon discovers that Harper already has a sweetheart who is on her way to visit him and that she, Iola, must return to her tribe. A melodrama with an equally melodramatic ending. Cast includes Mary Pickford, Alfred Paget, Frank Evans, Dorothy Bernard.

results.title: Invocation Maya Deren
results.creator_credit: Jo Ann Kaplan and Arts Council of Great Britain
results.brief_description: Through her films, writing and lecturing, Maya Deren had a seminal influence on the emerging American avant-garde. She was able to work at her full intellectual and artistic capacity at a time when few women could do so. During the last ten years of her life, she became increasingly involved with Voudoun and the Haiti religion. In this film, the intensity of Maya Deren’s spirit is evoked by those who knew and worked with her, with rare recordings providing intimacy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jo Ann Kaplan and Arts Council of Great Britain

results.title: Invitation to the dance
results.creator_credit: Mary Field, BFI and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Dancing not only provides recreation: it develops grace and poise. This film shows the movements and the eurhythmic exercises which are part of every dancer’s training.

results.title: Invitation to music
results.brief_description: Shows glimpses of Firenze during its annual May Music Festival, including excerpts from Rossini, Mozart and Verdi, as well as a Punch and Judy show. Features the Orchestra and Chorus of the Firenze Musical May Festival and the Corp de Ballet of the Royal Opera House of Roma.

results.title: Invitation to an Indian wedding
results.creator_credit: Ramesh Gupta, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: A traditional Hindu wedding in Western India; local customs may vary but most weddings follow the same pattern. The parents consult, priests read the horoscopes of the couple and a formal betrothal is made. On the wedding day, special music is played and many symbolic ceremonies take place, followed by a reception and breakfast, and finally a colorful and exciting procession takes the bride to her new home.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ramesh Gupta, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India

results.title: Invisible armour
results.brief_description: The story of a Canadian community which mobilized the energy of all its citizens to protect the health of its children against the common threat of diphtheria. We see how all groups contribute to the success of an immunization campaign. High-school children act as publicists, churches and schools place the issue before parents, a volunteer registration committee makes a door-to-door survey, and as winter weather slows the progress of the drive, service clubs provide “toxoid taxis.” From the awareness of one or two, the community is stirred to act for the good of all.

results.title: Investment planning
results.creator_credit: David Hargreaves, Paul Ellis and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Management Techniques”.
Aims to clarify some of the problems of forecasting for managers of small and medium-sized businesses, thereby achieving control through forecasts. An investment policy is a plan for the future, and as such it needs to be both simple and effective.

results.title: Investigators: Divorce special
results.creator_credit: Catherine Shirley and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: This special edition of “The Investigators” looks at how two people can disentangle their lives when their marriage grinds to a halt. It is a consumer guide on how to ease the pain and loss of separation and includes useful hints on how to make a divorce less painful, if not more amicable.
